content.title: Fenestrated and Branched Endovascular Aortic Repair
content.description: Complex endovascular repair using custom or physician-modified grafts with fenestrations or branches to incorporate visceral and renal vessels.

fenestrated.mechanism: Holes in graft fabric aligned with branch vessels
fenestrated.sealing: Covered stent from fenestration into branch vessel

branched.sealing: Bridging stent from branch into vessel

planning.clock_positions: Branch vessel positions mapped to graft design

content.statement: Fenestrated and Branched Endovascular Aortic Repair is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures Aortic that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Fenestrated and Branched Endovascular Aortic Repair helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Fenestrated and Branched Endovascular Aortic Repair include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Fenestrated and Branched Endovascular Aortic Repair.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Fenestrated and Branched Endovascular Aortic Repair. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
